Duties and Responsibilities


	The Chief Operating Officer will provide day-to-day leadership and management in all areas of the company&rsquo;s business operations (including sales, marketing, human resources, IT, administration, &amp;operations).
	The COO will manage the critical leadership function of strategic planning &amp; execution. And will drive the development of the company&rsquo;s business strategies to respond to market conditions and demands.
	Lead the execution of these strategies &amp; plans operationally, cascaded to other leaders, managers and employees within the company, and manage the associated communication of important strategy elements in a systemic manner.
	The COO will work with the CFO for the development of the annual plans and budget, and ensure the reporting of business performance to executive management and other key stakeholders with emphasis on delivery of business revenue &amp; profit objectives and major issues, risks and dependencies.
	The COO will drive focused execution, establishing performance metrics and monitoring systems to track progress toward those goals &amp; objectives; coach staff in achieving their goals
	As the senior officer with operations oversight, the COO will ensure that the company meets all regulatory &amp; compliance requirements, including legal, financial, human resources, operating, technology, etc., by putting in place policies and processes across the business
	Other duties as assigned by the board or the Managing Director.


Key Performance Indicators


	External stakeholder relationship management
	Strategic Plans completed on time/year
	Percentage of Strategic Plan Implemented
	Operational Plans completed on time/year

	Leadership provided &amp;core team atmosphere
	Ability to recruit, retain and develop talented people

	The best candidate for this role will be a strong leader with a proven record of operational and financial acumen and excellence.

	Extensive client relationship management experience required
	Familiarity with governance, especially in working with and managing the reporting process and sundry activities associated with a strong board having oversight functions, will be essential.

	Leadership.

	Decision Making.
	Financial Management.

Chief Operating Officer Job at Montaigne AH Limited




        
    

        
        Montaigne AH Limited popularly known as Montaigne Place is Nigeria's largest Luxury Skincare, Cosmetic, Fragrance and Well-being retail company.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Chief Operating Officer
Job Location: Lagos

Duties and Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Chief Operating Officer will provide day-to-day leadership and management in all areas of the company’s business operations (including sales, marketing, human resources, IT, administration, &operations).
	The COO will manage the critical leadership function of strategic planning & execution. And will drive the development of the company’s business strategies to respond to market conditions and demands.
	Lead the execution of these strategies & plans operationally, cascaded to other leaders, managers and employees within the company, and manage the associated communication of important strategy elements in a systemic manner.
	The COO will work with the CFO for the development of the annual plans and budget, and ensure the reporting of business performance to executive management and other key stakeholders with emphasis on delivery of business revenue & profit objectives and major issues, risks and dependencies.
	The COO will drive focused execution, establishing performance metrics and monitoring systems to track progress toward those goals & objectives; coach staff in achieving their goals
	As the senior officer with operations oversight, the COO will ensure that the company meets all regulatory & compliance requirements, including legal, financial, human resources, operating, technology, etc., by putting in place policies and processes across the business
	Other duties as assigned by the board or the Managing Director.


Key Performance Indicators


	External stakeholder relationship management
	Strategic Plans completed on time/year
	Percentage of Strategic Plan Implemented
	Operational Plans completed on time/year
	Percentage of Operational Plan Implemented
	Company Operating Revenue as well as Profitability
	Cashflow generated
	Cost Efficiency/Cost Management
	Optimising operational performance
	Increasing efficiency in operations
	Performance and agility of the operations function
	Employee Engagement
	Corporate Culture
	Financial Reporting
	Improvement in the company’s financial metrics
	Compliance
	The company’s ethical standing
	Leadership provided &core team atmosphere
	Ability to recruit, retain and develop talented people
	Business model innovation outside of core operations.


Qualifications


	Minimum Education: Master's Degree.


Required Experience:


	The best candidate for this role will be a strong leader with a proven record of operational and financial acumen and excellence.
	10+ years of experience in Executive/Senior Operations Management businesses
	Experience in Executive/Senior Management roles in the Luxury goods industry/FMCG or CPG Industry.
	COO should have experience and be knowledgeable about how to establish systems and controls to manage a business that holds physical inventory and trades through hundreds of outlets
	Experience in the fragrances, cosmetics, health & personal care related products industry will be an advantage
	Strategic Business Development experience required
	Extensive client relationship management experience required
	Familiarity with governance, especially in working with and managing the reporting process and sundry activities associated with a strong board having oversight functions, will be essential.
	Experience in leveraging technology to drive revenue & enhance the customer experience is required.


Required Competencies:


	Leadership.
	Strategic Thinking.
	Results Driven.
	Business Acumen.
	Decision Making.
	Financial Management.


Salary
N4,000,000 - N5,000,000 monthly.

Description


	As Group PM for Logistics Optimization at Jumia, you will lead the development and implementation of products and systems that maximize operational efficiency, drive automation, and enhance user experiences across all our markets.
	You will collaborate closely with engineering, data, commercial, and operations teams to deliver scalable solutions that directly impact Jumia&rsquo;s bottom line.&nbsp;


What you will be doing


	Own the vision, strategy, and roadmap for optimization products (e.g., pricing, logistics, supply chain, process automation) across the Jumia group.
	Analyze business processes to identify areas of improvement, automation, or cost reduction.
	Work with cross-functional teams (tech, data, commercial, operations) to translate business needs into actionable product features and requirements.
	Drive project execution from ideation through launch, ensuring timely delivery and high-quality output.

	Champion a culture of continuous improvement and experimentation.
	Communicate product vision, roadmaps, and updates to stakeholders at all levels.

	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Engineering, Business, Computer Science, or related field; MBA or similar is a &ldquo;plus&rdquo;.
	Proven experience (5+ years) in project management, ideally within e-commerce, logistics, first, middle and last mile operations, or process optimization at scale.
	Strong analytical skills, with a data-driven approach to decision-making.
	Experience working with tech, data, and operations teams on complex products.
	Excellent project management and stakeholder communication skills.
	Proficiency in tools for product/project management (Jira, Confluence, etc.) and analytics (SQL, Tableau, etc.).

	A unique experience in an entrepreneurial, yet structured environment
	A unique opportunity of having strong impact in building the African e-commerce sector

Project Manager - Logistics Optimization Job at Jumia




        
    

        
        Jumia is Africa's leading internet group, with already over 3,000 employees in more than 20 African countries and huge successes such as Jumia, Jumia Travel, Jumia Food, Jumia Deals, Jumia House, Jumia Jobs and Jumia Services. It is led by top talented leaders offering a great mix of local and international talents and is backed by MTN, Millicom, Rocket Internet, Axa, Orange, Goldman Sachs & CdC.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Manager - Logistics Optimization

Job Location: Nigeria
Job type: Full Time

Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	As Group PM for Logistics Optimization at Jumia, you will lead the development and implementation of products and systems that maximize operational efficiency, drive automation, and enhance user experiences across all our markets.
	You will collaborate closely with engineering, data, commercial, and operations teams to deliver scalable solutions that directly impact Jumia’s bottom line. 


What you will be doing


	Own the vision, strategy, and roadmap for optimization products (e.g., pricing, logistics, supply chain, process automation) across the Jumia group.
	Analyze business processes to identify areas of improvement, automation, or cost reduction.
	Work with cross-functional teams (tech, data, commercial, operations) to translate business needs into actionable product features and requirements.
	Drive project execution from ideation through launch, ensuring timely delivery and high-quality output.
	Monitor product performance, set KPIs, and iterate based on data-driven insights.
	Champion a culture of continuous improvement and experimentation.
	Communicate product vision, roadmaps, and updates to stakeholders at all levels.


What we are looking for


	Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Business, Computer Science, or related field; MBA or similar is a “plus”.
	Proven experience (5+ years) in project management, ideally within e-commerce, logistics, first, middle and last mile operations, or process optimization at scale.
	Strong analytical skills, with a data-driven approach to decision-making.
	Experience working with tech, data, and operations teams on complex products.
	Excellent project management and stakeholder communication skills.
	Proficiency in tools for product/project management (Jira, Confluence, etc.) and analytics (SQL, Tableau, etc.).
	Fluency in English; French is a “plus”.


We Offer


	A unique experience in an entrepreneurial, yet structured environment
	A unique opportunity of having strong impact in building the African e-commerce sector
	The opportunity to become part of a highly professional and dynamic team
	An unparalleled personal and professional growth as our longer-term objective is to train the next generation of leaders.
